case_title: Sher Bahader, Advocate, Takht Bhai vs Sher Zaman

accussed_details.name: Sher Bahader
allegation: Fraudulently extracted Rs. 16,300 for litigation expenses, including Rs. 7,500 for court fees on a declaratory civil suit.
Failed to conduct cases and refused to return received fees.
Fraudulent extraction of additional amounts for miscellaneous expenses.

complaint_summary: Sher Zaman alleged that Sher Bahader, Advocate, fraudulently extracted Rs. 16,300 for litigation expenses, failed to conduct cases, and refused to return the fees. The complaint was filed on 2000-06-13, requesting professional misconduct proceedings.
investigation_summary: The Disciplinary Committee of the N.-W.F.P. Bar Council, Peshawar, issued notices, recorded partial evidence, and imposed costs on both parties for adjournments. Key dates included notice issuance on 2000-07-10, partial evidence recording on 2000-10-21, and rejection of the review petition on 2001-04-07. Sher Bahader contested the allegations and argued against the imposition of costs due to medical indisposition, but his medical certificate was deemed unreliable.

key_findings: Adjournment requested by petitioner without proper documentation.
Costs imposed were nominal and equitable.
Medical certificate submitted was undated and appeared to be an afterthought.
judgment_summary.final_decision: The revision petition filed by Sher Bahader was dismissed. The court upheld the imposition of Rs. 500 costs as equitable and sound judicial discretion.

punishment: No punishment imposed; costs of Rs. 500 upheld.
legal_arguments: Sher Bahader argued that the imposition of costs was unwarranted due to his medical indisposition.
The court found the medical certificate undated and likely procured after the fact, deeming it unreliable.
The court emphasized the discretionary power under Order 17, Rule 1 and sub-rule (2), C.P.C., to impose costs for adjournments.

revision_petition_details.grounds_for_revision: Imposition of Rs. 500 costs on petitioner deemed unwarranted due to medical indisposition.
revision_petition_details.medical_certificate_status: Undated and submitted late, deemed unreliable.
revision_petition_details.court_discretion: Costs imposed to compensate complainant for witness expenses, not as penalty.

witnesses: Witnesses of Sher Zaman (names not provided)

witness_statement.Sher Zaman's witnesses: Present during hearings; their diet money was compensated through costs imposed on Sher Bahader.

key_issues: Fraudulent extraction of money by a lawyer

maxims.Judicial discretion: Costs imposed to compensate expenses incurred by witnesses, not as a penalty.

legal_terms.Professional Misconduct: Violation of ethical standards by a practicing lawyer.
legal_terms.Diet Money: Compensation for expenses incurred by witnesses attending court.

words_and_phrases.Adjournment: Postponement of court proceedings to a later date.
words_and_phrases.Costs: Monetary compensation imposed by the court for expenses incurred.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves allegations of professional misconduct against Sher Bahader, Advocate, by Sher Zaman. The court upheld the imposition of costs for adjournments and dismissed the revision petition, emphasizing judicial discretion and equity.
